quotes: Kenewendo was born in Motopi Village in the Boteti Area, in Botswana circa 1987.
In 2016, the then president of Botswana, Ian Khama, nominated Kenewendo to the Parliament of Botswana
On 4 April 2018, the new incoming president, Mokgweetsi Masisi, appointed Kenewendo as the new Minister of Investment, Trade and Industry.
In her capacity as minister, Kenewendo was appointed by United Nations Secretary General António Guterres in 2018 to the High-level Panel on Digital Cooperation

time_markers.text: When the United Kingdom assumed the presidency of the G7 in 2021
quotes: When the United Kingdom assumed the presidency of the G7 in 2021, Kenewendo was appointed by the country's Minister for Women and Equalities, Liz Truss, to a newly formed Gender Equality Advisory Council (GEAC)
The year 2024 set a different tone for

organizations.name: Pitzer College in Botswana
quotes: After attending primary school, she enrolled in Pitzer College in Botswana.

organizations.name: University of Botswana
quotes: She was then admitted to the University of Botswana, graduating with a Bachelor of Arts in Economics.

organizations.name: University of Sussex
quotes: Later, she obtained a Master of Science in International Economics from the University of Sussex in the United Kingdom.

organizations.name: Foundation for Economic Education
quotes: She received training in Economic Freedom Philosophy from the Foundation for Economic Education.

organizations.name: Ghanaian Ministry of Trade and Industry
quotes: Kenewendo worked as a trade economist ODI Fellow in the Ghanaian Ministry of Trade and Industry.

organizations.name: Econsult Botswana
quotes: She also served as an economic consultant at Econsult Botswana, a Gaborone-based think tank.
